content.description:
Stand start, about 5-6 moves. A bad left hand crimp and good feet launch you to the top jug and mantle to finish. Fun problem but rock is a little chossy. Significant lichen on the west face.

 Possible sit start that could go at V5-6
content.location: 40 ft off the dirt road. Probably the second largest boulder at the pond. Heading from the parking lot, go left around the pond.

content.description: This is a very picturesque public pond with many trails and a dirt road wrapping around the entire pond. The pond feeds into Massabesic, Manchester’s source of drinking water so swimming or wading in the water is prohibited. The area is popular among local hikers, joggers, and dog walkers. It has several boulders hanging over the water. You can only climb these in the winter! The pond freezes nicely and typically the water level is dropped from Dec-March making it possible to set up a pad.
